image.altText: A photo of Mike Reynolds sitting in a black suit and looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: In the days after WA's first recorded death in juvenile detention, the government sacked its corrective services commissioner, Mike Reynolds. He now details the chaos behind the scenes during his tenure for the first time.

title.children: Sacked corrective services boss speaks out on youth justice 'chaos' which culminated in teen's death

image.altText: A man in an electric whelchair next to a tree.

props.synopsis: A 68-year-old West Australian man who assaulted seven "isolated" and "vulnerable" women who were working for him as NDIS-funded carers has received a fine and a suspended jail term.

title.children: Elderly man who inappropriately touched his young NDIS-funded care workers given suspended prison term

image.altText: Tamak Vijay walking outside of court with his hand near his mouth. A reporter's microphone can be seen on the left.

props.synopsis: A driving assessor indecently touched young women as they were taking their licence tests, instructing one to park on a deserted street where he placed his hand on her thigh, a Perth court has been told.

title.children: City councillor on trial after allegedly indecently assaulting women while working as driving instructor

image.altText: Daniel Venables celebrates a goal for West Coast against the Bulldogs

props.synopsis: Former West Coast Eagles player Daniel Venables has reactivated a legal case against the club and the AFL over a head injury he received in 2019.

title.children: Footballer who suffered career-ending concussion gets green light to sue West Coast Eagles

image.altText: Illuminated purple and white Telstra Shop signage outside Brisbane CBD store.

props.synopsis: Residents in WA's southern Wheatbelt have been left dismayed after Telstra told them to buy more communications services to avoid future blackouts.

title.children: Telstra tells angry WA customers to buy more services after week-long mobile, internet outage

image.altText: Demountable-style buildings at a dusty construction site.

props.synopsis: A major lithium company is looking to sell a camp with the capacity to accommodate almost 400 workers after cutting jobs and scaling back expansion plans at its refinery south of Perth.

title.children: US resources giant looks to sell unfinished workers' camp as lithium price crawls 'along the bottom'

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden says he has discussed possible Israeli strikes on Iranian oil facilities, with his comments causing a spike in oil prices.

title.children: US is 'discussing' possible Israeli strikes on Iran oil facilities, as Israel warns southern Lebanon residents to evacuate

image.altText: Two dingoes walking through the wide open cage

props.synopsis: The Shire of Murchison says it's "unlikely" two popular pet dingoes on farmstay Wooleen Station were shot under its bounty system.

title.children: Council defends dingo bounty after disappearance of two 'pets' helping station's conservation effort

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: The White House has been urged to speed up sharing of sensitive military technology with Australia, agreed under the AUKUS deal, so the nations can jointly develop future weapons.

title.children: Biden urged to speed up sensitive military exports to Australia over 'grave and imminent' China threat

image.altText: Large yellow ant hill-like structures in yellow sand under a blue cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Western science has long debated when the towering pillars of the Pinnacles came to be. A new study suggests most of the spires formed when a particularly wet period dissolved the surrounding rock.

title.children: They may look like ant hills, but WA's Pinnacles are 100,000 years old, study suggests

image.altText: A balcony overlooking water.

props.synopsis: Queensland authorities are probing the fees residents are charged to sell retirement villas, following an ABC investigation into the multi-billion-dollar sector.

title.children: State government to probe retirement village provider's close ties to real estate company

image.altText: Dental xray illuminated on a light screen.

props.synopsis: A new report shows many Australians are delaying dentist visits or waiting years to receive publicly funded care — and in some parts of the country, wait times are going up.

title.children: Thousands of Australians are hospitalised for potentially preventable dental conditions, report shows

image.altText: An artist's illustration shows an apartment complex full of activity.

props.synopsis: Artist renderings of public housing built by a proposed government-owned developer have been released by the Greens — as well as their $40 billion price tag.

title.children: The Greens say you could live in this 'beautiful' home, but the scheme would cost taxpayers $40b

image.altText: The front gate of a medium security prison.

props.synopsis: The state's work safety watchdog will take the operator of Bunbury Regional Prison to court, claiming it failed to have systems in place to deal with allegations of sexual harassment and bullying.

title.children: WorkSafe to take justice department to court after alleged sexual harassment and bullying at WA prison

image.altText: A series of photos of someone in a kitchen, taken from ground level

props.synopsis: Without even entering the building, we were able to silently peer through the camera on a Deebot device made by Chinese giant Ecovacs.

title.children: The world's largest home robotics company has a problem – its vacuum cleaners can be hacked from afar

image.altText: The Karratha Gas Plant

props.synopsis: Far from shoring up the state's gas supplies, industry analysts say the WA government's approach incentivises more exports.

title.children: Analysts warn household gas prices likely to rise as WA encourages more drilling

image.altText: Tech graphic

props.synopsis: Ever received a scam text from Australia Post while you're waiting for a package? Or a fake toll notice after you've driven on a toll road? Experts say data collected by the online advertising industry could be behind it.

title.children: The completely legal trick scammers can exploit to target millions of Australians

image.altText: Donald Trump does a fist pump.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump likely won't face court again before next month's election but that doesn't mean the wheels aren't still turning on the criminal cases against him.

title.children: A month from the US election, a new court document has brought Trump's alleged crimes back into focus

image.altText: A for sale sign out the front of an apartment building.

props.synopsis: We asked three experts for their tips to first home buyers. This is what they said.

title.children: House prices are on the rise but these experts say there's still room for first home buyers

image.altText: Image of a coal mine from above with what appears to be activity

props.synopsis: A coal mining group with former links to a US fraudster denies claims of illegal mining, and destroying koala habitat without federal approval. Environment groups are doubling down, and want immediate action.

title.children: 'This is illegal coal mining': Koala habitat cleared without federal approval by company previously linked to fraudster

image.altText: A group of people, some wearing kiffeyeh and some with Palestine flags, stand smiling outside NSW court.

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestinian events for Sunday and Monday in Sydney will go ahead, after both NSW Police and organisers reached a late agreement in the background of a Supreme Court hearing.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian events in Sydney's CBD on Sunday and Monday to go ahead after last-minute agreement with police

image.altText: Flood damaged properties are seen on Federation Drive in the suburb of Bray Park.

props.synopsis: Researchers have found 23,000 Australians over the age of 15 have been displaced by floods, bushfires or cyclones on average every year since 2009.

title.children: This couple is selling up after an unexpected flood, with new research predicting more to be displaced from extreme weather

image.altText: Tourists take photos amongst statues of the ancient temple.

props.synopsis: As the federal government pursues closer economic ties with Indonesia, studies of the country's language and culture are on the decline across Australia.

title.children: Elite school faces criticism from Indonesian government over axing of language program

image.altText: Ben Simmons in action for the Brooklyn Nets

props.synopsis: After a nightmare three-year run, Ben Simmons insists he is fit and firing ahead of the upcoming NBA season. Whether he is able to take to the court consistently will determine just how long his future in the game is.

title.children: 'I'm pretty good': Ben Simmons is talking tough, but needs his game to back it up to save his basketball career

image.altText: A poster with a front-on photo of dolphin and writing in Japanese

props.synopsis: Over recent months, there have been multiple reports of a lone dolphin attacking swimmers. Why is it happening and what are authorities saying?

title.children: Lone dolphin appears to be behind series of 'attacks' on Japanese swimmers

image.altText: Flames burn on the outside of a multi-storey building as black smoke rises from the scene

props.synopsis: Typhoon Krathon has killed two people and injured more than 100 others in Taiwan, after displacing 5,000 in the Philippines earlier in the week.

title.children: Nine people killed in hospital fire in Taiwan as typhoon sweeps across the country

image.altText: Pauline David being lifted onto an accessible taxi

props.synopsis: Pauline David had to sleep in her wheelchair after an accessible taxi failed to arrive to take her home. She's one of many people with a disability struggling to maintain independence as the number of accessible cabs in NSW declines.

title.children: Pauline was forced to sleep in her wheelchair when an accessible taxi failed to turn up

image.altText: A rendering of PsiQuantum's Brisbane quantum computer

props.synopsis: Australia is making a billion-dollar bet on a "useful" quantum computer in the Queensland capital, but surprisingly few experts agree on what the nation will get in return for its investment.

title.children: Australia is bankrolling a $1b quantum computer in Brisbane. Big corporations will use it first

image.altText: A sign saying 'Ashley Youth Detention Centre' outside some fencing.

props.synopsis: A plan to build five facilities with a "therapeutic" approach to youth detention — to fill the gap when Tasmania's Ashley youth prison closes — appears to have been placed on the backburner, with the minister insisting it's not about cost.

title.children: Ashley Youth prison replacement plan shelved as Tasmanian government looks to fund existing services

image.altText: Nicola Gobbo, known as Lawyer X, wearing a leopard print top stares out a window

props.synopsis: In evidence in her civil lawsuit against the State of Victoria, lawyer turned police informer Nicola Gobbo says Victoria Police made frequent threats to strip her children from her custody if she did not comply with their orders.

title.children: 'I'm tired and broken': Nicola Gobbo details life in limbo and under police control in court

image.altText: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei

props.synopsis: Iran's "Axis of Resistance" is dedicated to countering US and Israeli influence in the Middle East. Here's a look at the group's key players and their roles in the current conflict.

title.children: What is Iran's so-called Axis of Resistance?

image.altText: Two figures silhouetted against the sunset, with a flat white layer of clouds stretching to the horizon behind them.

props.synopsis: Here's your quick guide on daylight saving time as Australia comes into the warmer months.

title.children: Daylight saving time starts in two days. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Vance and Walz shake hands.

props.synopsis: Time to test how much attention you've been paying to the news!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A Veep off, a Haka record, and the surprising place to find cheap groceries
